result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A. Golle

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Mark A. Golle. Defendant Mark A. Golle appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. This case is trailing 22CF1022.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order

Defendant Mark A. Golle in court, in custody.  Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Mark A. Golle.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Binger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: ST called witness ; KPD Ofc Jason Melichar sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Solis. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:12 PM   Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Zavier Solis.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:45 am..   Cash bond continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). rb
Atty Xavier Solis
Order to Withdraw - Granted
Proposed Order Granting Defense Counsel's Motion To Withdraw
To Withdraw

Defendant Mark A. Golle appeared with Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson.  Defendant in custody.   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State. Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Johnson moves to withdraw due to a conflict.  Court grants motion and allows Atty Johnson to withdraw.     DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Submitted by Atty Seth Johnson
